article.headline: St. Peter's 69, Fairleigh Dickinson 61
article.story: JERSEY CITY, N.J. -- Nick Leon scored 20 points and St. Peter's led from start to finish in a 69-61 win over Fairleigh Dickinson on Tuesday night. Ryan Bacon added 14 points and eight rebounds for the Peacocks (4-7), and Wesley Jenkins had 13 points. Sean Baptiste had a game-high 25 points for FDU (1-8), and Cameron Tyler added 17. St. Peter's jumped to an early 9-2 lead as Jenkins scored five points in the game's first three minutes. The teams played on nearly even terms for the rest of the half, and St. Peter's led 33-24 at intermission. Trailing 53-41 with 9:37 remaining, FDU went on a 10-2 run, closing to within four points at 55-51 on a fast break layup by Tyler with 6:28 to go. But a free throw and a jumper by Bacon stretched the lead to seven, and the Peacocks held on for the win.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
